questions.question: Benjamin Franklin is awakened and is excited to hear the news that...

choices.answer: General Washington attacked the Hessians in Trenton.
the Americans have gained the support of the French.
the British have decided to quit fighting the colonists.
the British surrendered at Saratoga.

questions.question: In the winter of 1778, General Howe and his army...

choices.answer: occupy Philadelphia.
retreat from Boston.
run low on supplies.
corner Washington at Fort Burgess.

questions.question: Why would it be so important that Franklin's press was rescued from Philadelphia?

choices.answer: It cost an enormous amount of money.
It was used to print money for the colonists.
It was crucial in spreading the message of the Rebels.
It was the only printing press in the region.

questions.question: The Rebels ________ to remind the British that they were NOT in England.

choices.answer: threw bricks through windows
tarred and feathered the Redcoats
yelled insults at the Redcoats
stole valuables from Redcoats

questions.question: Benjamin Franklin moved out of Paris into a chateau in ...

choices.answer: London, England
St. Milo, France
Richmond, Virginia
Passy, France

questions.question: Why did Moses Michael Hays' family, the Jewish shop owner, move to the colonies?

choices.answer: to join the rebellion
for religious freedom
to open his store
to be with his family

questions.question: King Louie doesn't want to sign a treaty with America because his brother, the king of Spain...

choices.answer: is an enemy of the colonists.
has signed a peace treaty with England.
is afraid America will steal Spain's land in America also.
is jealous of Franklin because of his enormous popularity.

questions.question: General Howe assumes that the Rebels...

choices.answer: are gearing up for one final attack to regain Philadelphia.
will continue to fight until the British can kill them.
are too disorganized to fight against the mighty British.
will give up because the French won't support them.

questions.question: What did the Rebels accuse  Moses Michael Hays of?

choices.answer: They thought he was a spy.
They thought he was stealing from them.
They thought he was a Tory.
They were tired of his treatment of slaves.

questions.question: Paul Wentworth informs Dr. Franklin that Britain is willing to fight America for ____ years.
Why wouldn't Moses Michael Hays sign the public oath of loyalty to the cause of the Rebels?

choices.answer: He didn't want to anger the British government.
He felt he was being picked on because he was Jewish.
He was afraid he would be forced to close his shop.
He had already signed an oath and didn't want to look weak.

questions.question: At the end of this episode, which of these do we NOT discover?

choices.answer: France has decided to sign a treaty with the Americans.
There will be war between Britain and France.
Edward Bancroft, Franklin's secretary, is actually a spy.
Silas Dean switched sides and accused Franklin of treason.

questions.question: After Hays stood up for the equal treatment of all men, ...

choices.answer: the Rhode Island assembly decided to all sign the oath.
he was thrown in prison.
Benjamin Franklin apologized and gave him a job.
Sam Adams enlisted him to become a representative.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT true of the treaty with France?

choices.answer: Richard Henry Lee brought it before Congress.
It was unanimously passed.
Benjamin Franklin delivered it to the colonies.
It was celebrated in the colonies.
